paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician upon Gittith, A Psalm of Asaph.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician upon Gittith, A Psalm of Asaph.

paragraphs.content: Sing aloud unto God our strength: make a joyful noise unto the God of Jacob.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Sing aloud unto God our strength: make a joyful noise unto the God of Jacob.

paragraphs.content: Take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel, the pleasant harp with the psaltery.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel, the pleasant harp with the psaltery.

paragraphs.content: Blow up the trumpet in the new moon, in the time appointed, on our solemn feast day.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blow up the trumpet in the new moon, in the time appointed, on our solemn feast day.

paragraphs.content: For this was a statute for Israel, and a law of the God of Jacob.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For this was a statute for Israel, and a law of the God of Jacob.

paragraphs.content: This he ordained in Joseph for a testimony, when he went out through the land of Egypt: where I heard a language that I understood not.
paragraphs.contentHtml: This he ordained in Joseph for a testimony, when he went out through the land of Egypt: where I heard a language that I understood not.

paragraphs.content: I removed his shoulder from the burden: his hands were delivered from the pots.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I removed his shoulder from the burden: his hands were delivered from the pots.

paragraphs.content: Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee; I answered thee in the secret place of thunder: I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee; I answered thee in the secret place of thunder: I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah.

paragraphs.content: Hear, O my people, and I will testify unto thee: O Israel, if thou wilt hearken unto me;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear, O my people, and I will testify unto thee: O Israel, if thou wilt hearken unto me;

paragraphs.content: There shall no strange god be in thee; neither shalt thou worship any strange god.
paragraphs.contentHtml: There shall no strange god be in thee; neither shalt thou worship any strange god.

paragraphs.content: I am the LORD thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I am the Lord thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.

paragraphs.content: But my people would not hearken to my voice; and Israel would none of me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But my people would not hearken to my voice; and Israel would none of me.

paragraphs.content: So I gave them up unto their own hearts’ lust: and they walked in their own counsels.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So I gave them up unto their own hearts’ lust: and they walked in their own counsels.

paragraphs.content: Oh that my people had hearkened unto me, and Israel had walked in my ways!
paragraphs.contentHtml: Oh that my people had hearkened unto me, and Israel had walked in my ways!

paragraphs.content: I should soon have subdued their enemies, and turned my hand against their adversaries.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I should soon have subdued their enemies, and turned my hand against their adversaries.

paragraphs.content: The haters of the LORD should have submitted themselves unto him: but their time should have endured for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The haters of the Lord should have submitted themselves unto him: but their time should have endured for ever.

paragraphs.content: He should have fed them also with the finest of the wheat: and with honey out of the rock should I have satisfied thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He should have fed them also with the finest of the wheat: and with honey out of the rock should I have satisfied thee.
